entries: Starting at rank 2, your coin of decisionry becomes a common magic item. When you flip the coin, it always lands with the Acquisitions Incorporated sigil face down, and a message appears on the "tails" face. Roll a {@dice d4} on the following table to determine the message.

rows: Lucrative
Brand Appeal
Indeterminate
Ruinous

entries: The coin has absolutely no divination abilities, and its results when you use it are random. But nobody else knows that. Quan una criatura within 10 feet of you flips the coin (after having had its powerful prognostication powers dutifully explained), you can exert your will to control its operation com a acció bonus, choosing the result that appears after it lands as a means of gently coercing the user toward a specific course of action. The creature flipping the coin can detect your manipulation with a successful DC 13 Saviesa ({@skill Perspicàcia}) check.

entries.name: Better Odds
entries: When you reach rank 3, your coin of decisionry gains a measure of actual divination power and becomes an uncommon magic item. In addition to its normal function, pots, com a acció, flip the coin of decisionry twice while pondering a specific plan or objective, noting both random results. If you succeed on una tirada d'Intel·ligència ({@skill Arcana}) amb CD 15, you learn which of the two results is more applicable to the course of action. This property of the coin no es pot tornar a utilitzar fins el proper trenc d'alba.

item.name: Coin of Delving
entries: This scintillating copper coin sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius. If dropped a distance greater than 5 feet, the coin issues a melodious ringing sound when it hits a surface. Any creature that can hear the chime can determine the distance the coin dropped based on the tone.

item.name: Cold Absorbing Tattoo
entries: {#itemEntry Absorbing Tattoo|TCE}

item.name: Common Glamerweave
entries: Glamerweave is clothing imbued with harmless illusory magic. While wearing the common version of these clothes, pots, com a acció bonus, create a moving illusory pattern within the cloth.

item.name: Bossa de Components
entries: A bossa de components is a small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost (as indicated in a spell's description).

item.name: Concertina
entries: A concertina is a less charming kind of accordion.
In addition to knocking out a killer polka, a creature playing the concertina can use an action to cause an area of mist or water fins a 30 peus in diameter and 6 inches deep to freeze solid.
Once used, this feature of the concertina no es pot tornar a utilitzar fins el proper trenc d'alba.

Any creatures touching the floor ha de salvar per Destresa (CD 20). Si falla, be restrained by the ice. Com a acció, a {@condition restrained} creature can attempt to free itself or another creature within its reach from the ice, doing so with a successful DC 20 Força ({@skill Atletisme}) check. A character freed from the ice is no longer restrained by it. The ice melts in an hour.

item.name: Conch of Safe Rest
entries: Pots, com a acció, blow this pearlescent conch like a horn, creating an effect identical with that of a {@spell Barraca Diminuta d'en Leomund} spell. The conch disappears once the spell takes effect. The effect ends if you leave the spell's area.

item.name: Conch of Teleportation
entries: This item is an ordinary, albeit rather large, conch shell that has been inscribed with the uvar rune. The conch measures 2½ feet long and weighs 20 pounds.

Com a acció, you can cast the {@spell teleportació} spell by blowing into the shell. The destination is fixed, and there is no chance of either a mishap or the spell being off target. Anyone teleported by the conch appears in a specific location designated by the item's creator at the time the uvar rune is inscribed on the conch. It doesn't allow teleportation to any other destination. Once its spell is cast, the conch no es pot tornar a utilitzar fins el proper trenc d'alba.

item.name: Utensilis de Cuina
additionalEntries: Adventuring is a hard life. With a cook along on the journey, your meals will be much better than the typical mix of hardtack and dried fruit.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Utensilis de Cuina include a metal pot, knives, forks, a stirring spoon, and a ladle.

additionalEntries.name: Història
entries: Your knowledge of cooking techniques allows you to assess the social patterns involved in a culture's eating habits.

additionalEntries.name: Medicina
entries: When administering treatment, you can transform medicine that is bitter or sour into a pleasing concoction.

additionalEntries.name: Survival
entries: When foraging for food, you can make do with ingredients you scavenge that others would be unable to transform into nourishing meals.

additionalEntries.name: Prepare Meals
entries: Com a part d'un Descans Curt, you can prepare a tasty meal that helps your companions regain their strength. You and up to five creatures of your choice regain 1 extra hit point per Dau de Vida spent during a short rest, provided you have access to your utensilis de cuina and sufficient food.

additionalEntries.caption: Utensilis de Cuina
rows: Create a typical meal
Duplicate a meal
Spot poison or impurities in food
Create a gourmet meal

item.name: Copper (cp)
entries: Common coins come in several different denominations based on the relative worth of the metal from which they are made. The three most common coins are the gold piece (gp), the silver piece (sp), and the copper piece (cp).

With one gold piece, a character can buy a belt pouch, 50 feet of good rope, or a goat. A skilled (but not exceptional) artisan can earn one gold piece a day. The gold piece is the standard unit of measure for wealth, even if the coin itself is not commonly used. When merchants discuss deals that involve goods or services worth hundreds or thousands of gold pieces, the transactions don't usually involve the exchange of individual coins. Rather, the gold piece is a standard measure of value, and the actual exchange is in gold bars, letters of credit, or valuable goods.
One gold piece is worth ten silver pieces, the most prevalent coin among commoners. A silver piece buys a laborer's work for a day, a flask of lamp oil, or a night's rest in a poor inn.
One silver piece is worth ten copper pieces, which are common among laborers and beggars. A single copper piece buys a candle, a torch, or a piece of chalk.

A més, unusual coins made of other precious metals sometimes appear in treasure hoards. The electrum piece (ep) and the platinum piece (pp) originate from fallen empires and lost kingdoms, and they sometimes arouse suspicion and skepticism when used in transactions. An electrum piece is worth five silver pieces, and a platinum piece is worth ten gold pieces.
A standard coin weighs about a third of an ounce, so fifty coins weigh a pound.

item.name: Cota d'Escates de Drac de Coure
entries: La cota d'escates de drac està feta d'escames d'un tipus de drac. Alguns dracs coleccionen les escates que han mudad i les regalen als humanoides. En altres casos els caçadors curen i preserven la pell d'un drac mort amb molta cura. Sia com sia, una cota d'escates de drac és molt valuosa. Mentre vesteixis l'armadura, tens: +1 a la CA; avantatge a salvar contra l'Alè d'Atac i la Presència Aterradora dels dracs; i resistència al dany d'àcid.

A més, pots, com a acció, percebre màgicament la distància i direcció al drac copper més proper a tu, fins a 30 milles d'abast. Aquesta acció especial no es pot tornar a utilitzar fins el proper trenc d'alba.

item.name: Copper stein with silver filigree (Coalició Temerària)
Coral
entries: An opaque crimson gemstone.

item.name: Cracked Driftglobe
entries: This small sphere of thick glass weighs 1 pound. If you are within 60 feet of it, pots dir la seva paraula màgica and cause it to emanate the {@spell llum} spell.

item.name: Crampons
entries: A crampon is a metal plate with spikes that is strapped to the sole of a boot. A creature wearing crampons can't fall {@condition enderrocat} while moving across {@hazard slippery ice}.

item.name: Crook of Rao
entries: Ages ago, the serene god Rao created a tool to shield his fledgling faithful against the evils of the Lower Planes. Yet, as eons passed, mortals developed their own methods of dealing with existential threats, and the crook was largely forgotten. In recent ages, though, the Crook of Rao was rediscovered and leveraged against the rising power of the Witch Queen Iggwilv (one of the names of the wizard Tasha). Although she was defeated, Iggwilv managed to damage the crook during the battle, infecting it with an insidious curse-and the potential for future victory. In the aftermath, the crook was again lost. Occasionally it reappears, but the famed artifact is not what it was. Whether or not the artifact's bearers realize its full threat, few risk using the Crook of Rao -potentially for the final time.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The artifact has the following random properties, which you can determine by rolling on the tables in the "Artifacts" section of the {@book Guia del Mestre de Masmorres|DMG}:

items: 2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} properties
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental} property

entries.name: Conjurs
entries: The crook té 6 càrregues. While holding it, pots, com a acció, expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells (save DC 18) from it: {@spell aura vital} (2 charges), {@spell aura de puresa} (2 charges), {@spell desterrament} (1 charge), {@spell far d'esperança} (1 charge), {@spell curar ferides massiu} (3 charges). The crook recupera {@dice 1d6} càrregues gastades cada dia a trenc d'alba.

entries.name: Absolute Desterrament
entries: While you are attuned to the crook and holding it, you can spend 10 minutes to banish all but the mightiest diastres within 1 mile of you. Any diastre with a challenge rating of 19 or higher is unaffected. Each banished diastre is sent back to its home plane and can't return to the plane the Crook of Rao banished it from for 100 years.

entries.name: Failing Matrix
entries: Whenever the Crook of Rao 's Absolute Banishment property is used, or when its last charge is expended, roll on the Extraplanar Reversal table. Any creatures conjured as a result of this effect appear in random unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you and are not under your control.

entries.name: Iggwilv's Curse
entries: When the Crook was last used against Iggwilv, the Witch Queen lashed out at the artifact, infecting its magical matrix. Over the years, this curse has spread within the crook, threatening to violently pervert its ancient magic. If this occurs, the Crook of Rao, as it is currently known, is destroyed, its magical matrix inverting and exploding into a 50-foot-diameter portal. This portal functions as a permanent {@spell portal} spell cast by Iggwilv. The gate then, once per round on initiative count 20, audibly speaks a fiend's name in Iggwilv's voice, doing so until the gate calls on every diastre ever banished by the Crook of Rao. If the diastre still exists, it is drawn through the gate. This process takes eighteen years to complete, at the end of which the gate becomes a permanent portal to Pazunia, the first layer of the Abyss.

entries.caption: Extraplanar Reversal
rows: A portal to a random plane opens. The portal closes after 5 minutes.
{@dice 2d4} {@creature imp||imps} and {@dice 2d4} {@creature quasit||quasits} appear.
{@dice 1d8} {@creature succubus||succubi}/{@creature incubus||incubi} appear.
{@dice 1d10} {@creature barbed devil||barbed devils} and {@dice 1d10} {@creature vrock||vrocks} appear.
1 arcanoloth, 1 {@creature night hag}, and 1 {@creature rakshasa} appear.
1 {@creature ice devil} and 1 {@creature marilith} appear.
1 {@creature balor} and 1 {@creature pit fiend} appear. At el/la/li MM's discretion, a portal opens into the presence of an archdevil or demon lord instead, then closes after 5 minutes.
Iggwilv's Curse (see the Iggwilv's Curse property).

entries.name: Destroying or Repairing the Crook
entries: The Crook of Rao can either be destroyed or repaired by journeying to Mount Celestia and obtaining a tear from the eternally serene god Rao. One way to make the emotionless god cry would be to reunite Rao with the spirit of his first worshiper who sought revelations beyond the multiverse long ago. The Crook dissolves if immersed in the god's tear for a year and a day. If washed in the tear daily for 30 days, the Crook loses its Failing Matrix property.

item.name: Crossbow Bolt Case
entries: This wooden case can hold up to twenty {@item crossbow bolt|phb|crossbow bolts}.

item.name: Crowbar
entries: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Força checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

item.name: Crown of the Forest
entries: Mentre vesteixis el crown, a character automatically fails any Intel·ligència ({@skill Investigació}) check made to see through an illusion. An illusion that is touched still has its true nature revealed. However, a character wearing a crown has such a strong sense that the illusion is real that they might not know which of their senses to believe.

If this crown is closely examined by a character who succeeds on a DC 20 Intel·ligència ({@skill Natura}) or Saviesa ({@skill Percepció}) check, or with a {@spell detectar màgia} spell cast using a 3rd-level or higher spell slot, the nature of its magic is discovered.

item.name: Crystal Ball
entries: This crystal ball is about 6 inches in diameter. While touching it, you can cast the {@spell escodrinyar} spell (save DC 17) with it.

item.name: Crystal Ball of Mind Reading
entries: This {@item crystal ball} is about 6 inches in diameter. While touching it, you can cast the {@spell escodrinyar} spell (save DC 17) with it.

Pots, com a acció, cast the {@spell detectar pensaments} spell (save DC 17) while you are {@spell escodrinyar} with the {@item crystal ball}, targeting creatures you can see within 30 feet of the spell's sensor. You don't need to concentrate on this {@spell detectar pensaments} to maintain it during its duration, but it ends if {@spell escodrinyar} ends.

item.name: Crystal Ball of Telepatia
entries: This {@item crystal ball} is about 6 inches in diameter. While touching it, you can cast the {@spell escodrinyar} spell (save DC 17) with it.

While {@spell escodrinyar} with the {@item crystal ball}, you can communicate telepathically with creatures you can see within 30 feet of the spell's sensor. You can also use an action to cast the {@spell suggestió} spell (save DC 17) through the sensor on one of those creatures. You don't need to concentrate on this suggestion to maintain it during its duration, but it ends if {@spell escodrinyar} ends. Once used, the suggestion power of the {@item crystal ball} no es pot tornar a utilitzar fins el proper trenc d'alba.

item.name: Crystal Ball of Visió Veritable
entries: This {@item crystal ball} is about 6 inches in diameter. While touching it, you can cast the {@spell escodrinyar} spell (save DC 17) with it.
While {@spell escodrinyar} with the {@item crystal ball}, you have {@sense truesight} with a radius of 120 feet centered on the spell's sensor.

item.name: Crystalline Chronicle
entries: An etched crystal sphere the size of a grapefruit hums faintly and pulses with irregular flares of inner light. While you are touching the crystal, you can retrieve and store information and spells within the crystal at the same rate as reading and writing. When found, the crystal contains the following spells: {@spell detectar pensaments}, {@spell fortalesa intel·lectual|TCE},* {@spell Vincle Telepàtic d'en Rary}, {@spell encàrrec}, {@spell Telequinesi}, {@spell Fuet Mental de la Tasha|TCE},* and {@spell Disc Flotant d'en Tenser} (spells with an asterisk appear in this book). It functions as a spellbook for you, with its spells and other writing psychically encoded within it.

While you are holding the crystal, you can use it com a focus de llançament arcà pels teus wizard spells, and you know the {@spell mà de mag}, {@spell estella mental|TCE} (appears in this book), and {@spell missatge} cantrips if you don't already know them.
The crystal has 3 charges, and recupera {@dice 1d3} càrregues gastades cada dia a trenc d'alba. You can use the charges in the following ways while holding it:

items: If you spend 1 minute studying the information within the crystal, you can expend 1 charge to replace one of your prepared wizard spells with a different spell in the book.
When you cast a wizard spell, you can expend 1 charge to cast the spell without verbal, somatic, or material components of up to 100 gp value.

item.name: Cube of Force
entries: This cube is about an inch across. Each face has a distinct marking on it that can be pressed. The cube starts with 36 charges, and recupera {@dice 1d20} càrregues gastades cada dia a trenc d'alba.

Pots, com a acció, press one of the cube's faces, expending a number of charges based on the chosen face, as shown in the Cube of Force Faces table. Each face has a different effect. If the cube has insufficient charges remaining, nothing happens. Otherwise, a barrier of {@condition invisible} force springs into existence, forming a cube 15 feet on a side. The barrier is centered on you, moves with you, and lasts for 1 minute, until you use an action to press the cube's sixth face, or the cube runs out of charges. You can change the barrier's effect by pressing a different face of the cube and expending the requisite number of charges, resetting the duration. If your movement causes the barrier to come into contact with a solid object that can't pass through the cube, you can't move any closer to that object as long as the barrier remains.

entries.caption: Cube of Force Faces
rows: Gases, wind, and fog can't pass through the barrier.
Nonliving matter can't pass through the barrier. Walls, floors, and ceilings can pass through at your discretion.
Living matter can't pass through the barrier.
Spell effects can't pass through the barrier.
Nothing can pass through the barrier. Walls, floors, and ceilings can pass through at your discretion.
The barrier deactivates.

entries: The cube loses charges when the barrier is targeted by certain spells or comes into contact with certain spell or magic item effects, as shown in the table below.

rows: {@spell Desintegrar}
{@dice 1d12}
{@item Banya del Xivarri}
{@dice 1d10}
{@spell Passaparets}
{@dice 1d6}
{@spell Esprai Prismàtic}
{@dice 1d20}
{@spell Paret de Foc}
{@dice 1d4}

item.name: Cubic Gate
entries: This cube is 3 inches across and radiates palpable magical energy. The six sides of the cube are each keyed to a different plane of existence, one of which is the Material Plane. The other sides are linked to planes determined by el/la/li MM.

Pots, com a acció, press one side of the cube to cast the {@spell portal} spell with it, opening a portal to the plane keyed to that side. Alternativament, if you use an action to press one side twice, you can cast the {@spell saltar de pla} spell (save DC 17) with the cube and transport the targets to the plane keyed to that side.
The cube té 3 càrregues. Each use of the cube expends 1 charge. The cube recupera {@dice 1d3} càrregues gastades cada dia a trenc d'alba.

item.name: Cursed Luckstone
entries: This flat, gray-and-black river stone is inscribed with an unknown arcane symbol and feels cool to the touch. While carrying the stone, you can gain advantage on one ability check of your choice. The stone no es pot tornar a utilitzar fins el proper trenc d'alba.

entries.name: Maledicció
entries: This item is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a anul·lar maledicció spell or similar magic. As long as you remain cursed, you cannot discard the stone, which immediately teleports back into your pocket or pack. After you use the stone's magic, your next two ability checks are made with disadvantage.

item.name: Daern's Instant Fortress
entries: Pots, com a acció, place this 1-inch metal cube on the ground and speak its paraula màgica. The cube rapidly grows into a fortress that remains until you use an action to speak the paraula màgica that dismisses it, which works only if the fortress is empty.

The fortress is a square tower, 20 feet on a side and 30 feet high, with arrow slits on all sides and a battlement atop it. Its interior is divided into two floors. with a ladder running along one wall to connect them. The ladder ends at a trapdoor leading to the roof. When activated, the tower has a small door on the side facing you. The door opens only at your command, which you can speak as a bonus action. It is immune to the {@spell picaporta} spell and similar magic, such as that of a {@item chime of opening}.

Tota criatura dins de l'àrea where the fortress appears ha de salvar per Destresa (CD 15), taking {@dice 10d10} de dany contundent; si supera, en rep la meitat. In either case, the creature is pushed to an unoccupied space outside but next to the fortress. Objects in the area que ningú estigui portant o vestint take this damage and are pushed automatically.

The tower is made of adamantine, and its magic prevents it from being tipped over. The roof, the door, and the walls each have 100 hit points, immunity to damage d'armes no-màgiques excluding siege weapons, and resistance to all other damage. Only a {@spell desig} spell can repair the fortress (this use of the spell counts as replicating a spell of 8th level or lower). Each casting of {@spell desig} causes the roof, the door, or one wall to regain 50 hit points.

item.name: Dagger of Visió a cegues
entries: This rare magic item requires attunement. A creature attuned to it gains {@sense visió a cegues} out to a range of 30 feet. The dagger has a saw-toothed edge and a black pearl nested in its pommel.

item.name: Dagger of Guitar Solos
entries: This drow-made dagger is decorated with silver web filigree. It magically plays a fragment of a guitar solo when struck or used to strike a foe.

item.name: Dagger of Venom
entries: Tens un +1 a attack and damage rolls made with this arma màgica.

Pots, com a acció, cause thick, black poison to coat the blade. The poison remains for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature ha de salvar per Constitució (CD 15). Si falla, rep {@dice 2d10} de dany de verí and become {@condition emmetzinat} durant 1 minut. The dagger no es pot tornar a utilitzar fins el proper trenc d'alba.

item.name: Dancing Monkey Fruit
entries: This rare magical fruit produces enough juice to fill a vial. Any humanoid that eats a dancing monkey fruit or drinks its juice ha de salvar per Constitució (CD 14). Si falla, begin a comic dance that dura 1 minut. Humanoids that can't be {@condition emmetzinat} are immune to this magical effect.

The dancer must use all its movement to dance without leaving its space and has disadvantage on attack rolls and Destresa saving throws, and other creatures have advantage on attack rolls against it. Each time it takes damage, the dancer can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. When the dancing effect ends, the humanoid suffers the {@condition emmetzinat} condition durant 1 hora.

item.name: Danoth's Visor
entries: These mitrall-frame goggles with clear diamond lenses were used by the evoker Danoth Oro to spot {@condition invisible} enemies and scout areas from afar.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: While wearing the goggles in their dormant state, pots veure-hi a la foscor màgica i no-màgica com de costum, to a distance of 60 feet. Additionally, tens avantatge a tirades de Intel·ligència ({@skill Investigació}) and Saviesa ({@skill Percepció}) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When Danoth's Visor reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: You see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects within 60 feet of you as if they were visible, and you can see into the Pla Etèri. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.

Com a acció bonus, you can speak a paraula màgica and use the goggles to see into and through solid matter. This vision has a radius of 60 feet and dura 1 minut. To you, solid objects within that radius appear transparent. The vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or fins a 3 peus of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does una fulla fina de plom. This property no es pot tornar a utilitzar fins el proper trenc d'alba.

Com a acció bonus, you can speak a paraula màgica to switch the goggles into spyglass mode. While in this mode, creatures and objects viewed through the goggles are magnified to twice their size. Speaking the paraula màgica again reverts the goggles to their normal operation.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When Danoth's Visor reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: You automatically detect illusions you can see and automatically succeed on saving throws against them. A més, you see a bright aura around any creature that isn't in its true form.
Com a acció, you can cast the {@spell camp antimàgic} spell from the visor. This property no es pot tornar a utilitzar fins el proper trenc d'alba.

item.name: Dark Shard Amulet
entries: This amulet is fashioned from a single shard of resilient extraplanar material originating from the realm of your warlock patron. While you are wearing it, obténs els beneficis següents:

items: You can use the amulet com a focus de llançament arcà pels teus warlock spells.

You can try to cast a cantrip that you don't know. The cantrip must be on the llista de conjurs de bruixot, and you must make una tirada d'Intel·ligència ({@skill Arcana}) amb CD 10. If the check succeeds, you cast the spell. If the check fails, so does the spell, and the action used to cast the spell is wasted. In either case, you can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Dawnbringer
item.reqAttune: by a creature of non-evil alignment
entries: Lost for ages in the Sotafoscor, Dawnbringer appears to be a gilded longsword hilt. While grasping the hilt, pots, com a acció bonus, make a blade of pure radiance spring from the hilt, or cause the blade to disappear. While the blade exists, this magic longsword has the finesse property. If you are proficient with {@item espasa curta|phb|shortswords} or {@item espasa llarga|phb|longswords}, you are proficient with Dawnbringer.

Tens un +2 a attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals radiant damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit an undead with it, that target takes an extra {@dice 1d8} de dany radiant.

The sword's luminous blade emits llum forta en un radi de 15 peus i llum tènue uns 15 peus adicionals. The light is sunlight. While the blade persists, pots, com a acció, expand or reduce its radius of bright and dim light by 5 feet each, to a maximum of 30 feet each or a minimum of 10 feet each.

While holding the weapon, pots, com a acció, touch a creature with the blade and cast {@spell restabliment menor} on that creature. Once used, this ability no es pot tornar a utilitzar fins el proper trenc d'alba.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: Dawnbringer is a sentient neutral good weapon with an Intel·ligència of 12, a Saviesa of 15, and a Carisma of 14. It has hearing and {@sense visió de foscor} out to a range of 120 feet.
The sword can speak, read, and understand Common, and it can communicate with its wielder telepathically. Its voice is kind and feminine. It knows every language you know while attuned to it.

entries.name: Personality
entries: Forged by ancient sun worshippers, Dawnbringer is meant to bring light into darkness and to fight creatures of darkness. It is kind and compassionate to those in need, but fierce and destructive to its enemies.

Long years lost in darkness have made Dawnbringer frightened of both the dark and abandonment. It prefers that its blade always be present and shedding light in areas of darkness, and it strongly resists being parted from its wielder for any length of time.

item.name: Decanter of Endless Water
entries: This stoppered flask sloshes when shaken, as if it contains water. The decanter weighs 2 pounds.

Pots, com a acció, remove the stopper and speak one of three paraula màgicas, whereupon an amount of fresh water or salt water (escull) pours out of the flask. The water stops pouring out at the start of your next turn. Choose from the following options:

items: "Stream" produces 1 gallon of water.
"Fountain" produces 5 gallons of water.

"Geyser" produces 30 gallons of water that gushes forth in a geyser 30 feet long and 1 foot wide. As a bonus action while holding the decanter, you can aim the geyser at una criatura que puguis veure a 30 peus d'abast. The target ha de salvar per Força (CD 13). Si falla, rep {@dice 1d4} de dany contundent and fall {@condition enderrocat}. Instead of a creature, you can target an object that isn't being worn or carried and that weighs no more than 200 pounds. The object is either knocked over or pushed fins a 15 peus lluny de tu.

item.name: Deck of Illusions
entries: This box contains a set of parchment cards. A full deck has 34 cards. A deck found as treasure is usually missing {@dice 1d20 - 1} cards.

The magic of the deck functions only if cards are drawn at random (you can use an altered deck of playing cards to simulate the deck). Pots, com a acció, draw a card at random from the deck and throw it to the ground at a point within 30 feet of you.

An illusion of one or more creatures forms over the thrown card and remains fins que sigui dissipat. An illusory creature appears real, of the appropriate size, and behaves as if it were a real creature, except that it can do no harm. While you are within 120 feet of the illusory creature and can see it, pots, com a acció, move it magically anywhere within 30 feet of its card. Any physical interaction with the illusory creature reveals it to be an illusion, because objects pass through it. Someone who uses an action to visually inspect the creature identifies it as illusory with a successful DC 15 Intel·ligència ({@skill Investigació}) check. The creature then appears translucent.
The illusion lasts until its card is moved or the illusion is dispelled. When the illusion ends, the image on its card disappears, and that card can't be used again.

rows: {@creature drac vermell dragon||Red Adult}
{@creature Knight} and four {@creature guard||guards}

item.name: Deck of Many Things
entries: Usually found in a box or pouch, this deck contains a number of cards made of ivory or vellum. Most (75 percent) of these decks have only thirteen cards, but the rest have twenty-two.

Before you draw a card, you must declare how many cards you intend to draw and then draw them randomly (you can use an altered deck of playing cards to simulate the deck). Any cards drawn in excess of this number have no effect. Otherwise, as soon as you draw a card from the deck, its magic takes effect. You must draw each card no more than 1 hour after the previous draw. If you fail to draw the chosen number, the remaining number of cards fly from the deck on their own and take effect all at once.
Once a card is drawn, it fades from existence. Unless the card is the Fool or the Jester, the card reappears in the deck, making it possible to draw the same card twice.

entries.name: A Question of Enmity
entries: Two of the cards in a deck of many things can earn a character the enmity of another being. With the Flames card, the enmity is overt. The character should experience the devil's malevolent efforts on multiple occasions. Seeking out the diastre shouldn't be a simple task, and the adventurer should clash with the devil's allies and followers a few times before being able to confront the devil itself.

In the case of the Rogue card, the enmity is secret and should come from someone thought to be a friend or an ally. As Dungeon Master, you should wait for a dramatically appropriate moment to reveal this enmity, leaving the adventurer guessing who is likely to become a betrayer.

entries.name: Vizier
entries: At any time you choose within one year of drawing this card, you can ask a question in meditation and mentally receive a truthful answer to that question. Besides information, the answer helps you solve a puzzling problem or other dilemma. In other words, the knowledge comes with wisdom on how to apply it.

entries.name: Sun
entries: You gain 50,000 PX, and a wondrous item (which el/la/li MM determines randomly) appears in your hands.

entries.name: Lluna
entries: You are granted the ability to cast the {@spell desig} spell {@dice 1d3} times.

entries.name: Star
entries: Increase one of your ability scores by 2. The score can exceed 20 but can't exceed 24.

entries.name: Comet
entries: If you single-handedly defeat the next hostile monster or group of monsters you encounter, you gain experience points enough to gain one level. Otherwise, this card has no effect.

entries.name: The Fates
entries: Reality's fabric unravels and spins anew, allowing you to avoid or erase one event as if it never happened. You can use the card's magic as soon as you draw the card or at any other time before you die.

entries.name: Throne
entries: Tens competència en l'habilitat {@skill Persuasion}, and you double el teu bonus de competència on checks made with that skill. A més, you gain rightful ownership of a small keep somewhere in the world. However, the keep is currently in the hands of monsters, which you must clear out before you can claim the keep as yours.

entries.name: Key
entries: A rare or rarer arma màgica with which you are proficient appears in your hands. El/la/li MM chooses the weapon.

entries.name: Knight
entries: You gain the service of a 4th-level fighter who appears in a space you choose within 30 feet of you. The fighter is of the same race as you and serves you loyally until death, believing the fates have drawn him or her to you. You control this character.

entries.name: Gem
entries: Twenty-five pieces of jewelry worth 2,000 gp each or fifty gems worth 1,000 gp each appear at your feet.

entries.name: Talons
entries: Every magic item you wear or carry disintegrates. Artifacts in your possession aren't destroyed but do vanish.

entries.name: The Void
entries: This black card spells disaster. Your soul is drawn from your body and contained in an object in a place of el/la/li MM's choice. One or more powerful beings guard the place. While your soul is trapped in this way, your body is {@condition incapacitat}. A {@spell desig} spell can't restore your soul, but the spell reveals the location of the object that holds it. You draw no more cards.

entries.name: Flames
entries: A powerful devil becomes your enemy. The devil seeks your ruin and plagues your life, savoring your suffering before attempting to slay you. This enmity lasts until either you or the devil dies.

entries.name: Skull
entries: You summon an {@creature avatar de la mort|dmg}-a ghostly humanoid skeleton clad in a tattered black robe and carrying a spectral scythe. It appears in a space of el/la/li MM's choice within 10 feet of you and attacks you, warning all others that you must win the battle alone. The avatar fights until you die or it es queda a 0 punts de vida, whereupon it disappears. If anyone tries to help you, the helper summons its own {@creature avatar de la mort|dmg}. A creature slain by an {@creature avatar de la mort|dmg} can't be restored to life.

entries.name: Idiot
entries: Permanently reduce your Intel·ligència by {@dice 1d4 + 1} (to a minimum score of 1). You can draw one additional card beyond your declared draws.

entries.name: Donjon
entries: You disappear and become entombed in a state of suspended animation in an extradimensional sphere. Everything you were wearing and carrying stays behind in the space you occupied when you disappeared. You remain imprisoned until you are found and removed from the sphere. You can't be located by any divination magic, but a {@spell desig} spell can reveal the location of your prison. You draw no more cards.

entries.name: Ruin
entries: All forms of wealth that you carry or own, other than magic items, are lost to you. Portable property vanishes. Businesses, buildings, and land you own are lost in a way that alters reality the least. Any documentation that proves you should own something lost to this card also disappears.

entries.name: Euryale
entries: The card's {@creature medusa}-like visage curses you. You take a -2 penalty on saving throws while cursed in this way. Only a god or the magic of The Fates card can end this curse.

entries.name: Rogue
entries: A nonplayer character of el/la/li MM's choice becomes hostile toward you. The identity of your new enemy isn't known until the NPC or someone else reveals it. Nothing less than a {@spell desig} spell or intervenció divina can end the NPC's hostility toward you.

entries.name: Balance
entries: Your mind suffers a wrenching alteration, causing your alignment to change. Lawful becomes chaotic, good becomes evil, and vice versa. If you are true neutral or unaligned, this card has no effect on you.

entries.name: Fool
entries: You lose 10,000 PX, discard this card, and draw from the deck again, counting both draws as one of your declared draws. If losing that much PX would cause you to lose a level, you instead lose an amount that leaves you with just enough PX to keep your level.

entries.name: Jester
entries: You gain 10,000 PX, or you can draw two additional cards beyond your declared draws.

item.name: Deck of Several Things
entries: Stored in a leather pouch, this unique deck contains twenty-two colored cards made of some strong but unknown metal, each of which features a design printed as a mosaic of raised dots. Before you draw a card, you must declare how many cards you intend to draw and then draw them randomly (you can use an altered deck of playing cards to simulate the deck). Any cards drawn in excess of this number have no effect. Otherwise, as soon as you draw a card from the deck, its magic takes effect. You must draw each card no more than 1 hour after the previous draw. If you fail to draw the chosen number, the remaining number of cards fly from the deck on their own and take effect all at once.
Once a card is drawn, it fades from existence. Unless the card is the Fool or the Jester, the card reappears in the deck, making it possible to draw the same card twice.

entries.name: Balance
entries: Your mind suffers a wrenching alteration, causing your alignment to change for the duration of the adventure. Lawful becomes chaotic, good becomes evil, and vice versa. If you are true neutral or unaligned, this card has no effect on you.

entries.name: Comet
entries: If you single-handedly defeat the next hostile monster or group of monsters you encounter, tens avantatge a tirades de ability checks made using one skill of your choice for the duration of the adventure. Otherwise, this card has no effect.

entries.name: Donjon
entries: You are instantly teleported to and confined within the prison of the Monastery of the Distressed Body (area M6). Everything you were wearing and carrying stays behind in the space you occupied when you disappeared. You draw no more cards.

entries.name: Euryale
entries: The card's medusa-like visage curses you. You take a −1 penalty on saving throws for the duration of the adventure.

entries.name: The Fates
entries: Reality's fabric unravels and spins anew, allowing you to avoid or erase one event as if it never happened. You can use the card's magic as soon as you draw the card or at any other point during the adventure.

entries.name: Flames
entries: The Grand Master of the Monastery of the Distressed Body becomes your enemy. The diable d'ossos seeks your ruin, savoring your suffering before attempting to slay you. If the Grand Master has already been defeated, you gain the enmity of Garret Levistusson's patron—a similarly powerful devil.

entries.name: Fool
entries: For the duration of the adventure, you lose proficiency with one skill or gain disadvantage on all checks made with one skill (with the skill and the penalty determined by el/la/li MM). Discard this card and draw from the deck again, counting both draws as one of your declared draws.

entries.name: Gem
entries: The 1,000 gp hoard of the leprechaun from the Wilderness Encounters table (see appendix A) appears at your feet. If that treasure has already been claimed, you gain an equivalent hoard.

entries.name: Idiot
entries: Reduce your Intel·ligència by {@dice 1d4 + 1} (to a minimum score of 1) for the duration of the adventure. You can draw one additional card beyond your declared draws.

entries.name: Jester
entries: You gain proficiency in a skill of your choice for the duration of the adventure, or you can draw two additional cards beyond your declared draws.

entries.name: Key
entries: A common or uncommon arma màgica with which you are proficient, or a {@item spell pergamí} featuring a spell of a level you can cast, appears in your hands. El/la/li MM chooses the weapon or spell, which you possess for the duration of this adventure.

entries.name: Knight
entries: You gain the service of any of the NPCs in the "{@book Hirelings|phb|5|services}" section not currently with the party, who appears in a space you choose within 30 feet of you. The NPC serves you loyally for the duration of the adventure, believing that the fates have drawn them to you. You control this character.

entries.name: Lluna
entries: You are granted the ability to cast any spell of 5th level or lower, and can use that ability {@dice 1d3} times for the duration of the adventure.

entries.name: Rogue
entries: An NPC of el/la/li MM's choice becomes secretly hostile toward you. The identity of your new enemy isn't known until the NPC or someone else reveals it. Any enchantment spell cast on the NPC at 6th level or higher can end the NPC's hostility toward you.

entries.name: Ruin
entries: All forms of wealth that you carry or own, other than magic items, are lost to you. This wealth can be recovered either in the treasury of the Monastery of the Distressed Body (area M10) or Kwalish's lab in Daoine Gloine (area O7), whichever comes later in the adventure.

entries.name: Skull
entries: You summon an avatar de la mort—a mechanical skeleton (use bone naga statistics) clad in a tattered black robe. It appears in a space of el/la/li MM's choice within 10 feet of you and attacks you, warning all others that you must win the battle alone. The avatar fights until you die or it es queda a 0 punts de vida, whereupon it disappears. If anyone tries to help you, the helper summons its own avatar de la mort. A creature slain by an avatar de la mort can't be restored to life.

entries.name: Star
entries: Increase one of your ability scores by 1 for the duration of the adventure. The score can exceed 20 but can't exceed 24.

entries.name: Sun
entries: Tens competència en skill of your choice for the duration of the adventure. A més, a common or uncommon wondrous item appears in your hands. El/la/li MM chooses the item, which you possess for the duration of this adventure.

entries.name: Talons
entries: Every magic item you wear or carry is lost to you. These items can be recovered either in the treasury of the Monastery of the Distressed Body (area M10) or Kwalish's lab in Daoine Gloine (area O7), whichever comes later in the adventure.

entries.name: Throne
entries: Tens competència en l'habilitat {@skill Persuasion} and you double el teu bonus de competència on checks made with that skill for the duration of the adventure. A més, the Monastery of the Distressed Body's brains in jars regard you thereafter as the monastery's rightful master. You must defeat or otherwise clear out the Grand Master and its servants before you can claim the monastery as yours.

entries.name: Vizier
entries: At any one time you choose within the duration of the adventure, you can ask a question in meditation and mentally receive a truthful answer to that question. Besides information, the answer helps you solve a puzzling problem or other dilemma. In other words, the knowledge comes with wisdom on how to apply it.

entries.name: The Void
entries: This black card spells disaster. Your soul is drawn from your body and held within machinery in either the control room of the Monastery of the Distressed Body (area M8) or Kwalish's lab in Daoine Gloine (area O7), whichever comes later in the adventure. While your soul is trapped in this way, your body is {@condition incapacitat}. {@spell Endevinació}, {@spell contactar plà forani}, or a similar spell of 4th level or higher reveals the location of the machinery that holds your soul. You draw no more cards.

entries.name: Using the Deck of Several Things
entries: The special nature of this deck (carried by Mary Greymalkin if she is used as an NPC) means that many of its effects operate only within and with respect to this specific adventure. This typically covers any time the characters spend between setting out for the Barrier Peaks and the resolution of whatever events transpire in Kwalish's lab (area O7).

For cards that effectively remove a character from play for a period of time (Donjon and the Void), you can allow a player to take on the role of one of the party's NPC hirelings, or introduce a temporary character as an NPC met during the party's journey. Alternativament, you can decide that only some aspect of the character's will disappears and is imprisoned, leaving the character to operate in a robotic state until freed.

item.name: Dekella, Bident of Thassa
entries: Thassa wields Dekella, a two-pronged weapon gifted to her by Purphoros. When the god of the sea bestows her weapon on a mortal, it's often so they might work her will far from the ocean, right some wrong affecting those she'd prefer not to harm, or give a mortal a glimpse of her terrible responsibilities.

entries.name: Bident of the Deep
entries: Thassa's signature weapon thrums with the icy currents of the deep ocean. This weapon functions as a trident that grants a +3 a les tirades d'impacte i de dany que faci. When you hit with an attack using the bident, l'objectiu rep un {@damage 2d10} extra de dany de fred.

entries.name: Blessing of the Deep
entries: If you are a worshiper of Thassa, you gain all the following benefits for which you have the required piety:

items.name: Piety 10+.
items.entry: You can breathe underwater, and reps una velocitat de natació de 60 peus.

items.name: Piety 25+.
items.entry: The bident has 1 randomly determined {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property.

items.name: Piety 50+.
items.entry: The bident has 1 randomly determined {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property.

entries: If you aren't a worshiper of Thassa, the bident has 1 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental} property and 1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Detrimental Properties|dmg|major detrimental} property, both randomly determined.
See "Artifacts" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for details on randomly determined properties.

entries.name: Command the Deep
entries: The bident holds the power to command the waves and its creatures. Com a acció, you can change the condition of the sea within 1 mile of you, creating strong winds and heavy rain that cause violent waves (see "Weather at Sea" in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide) or calming a storm. In either case, the unnatural weather dura 1 hora before returning to normal. Once used, this property of the bident can't be used again until the next dusk.

Additionally, you can cast the {@spell dominar criatura} spell (save DC 18) from the bident, but only on beasts and monstrosities that have an innate swimming speed. Once used, this property of the bident can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Aquatic Metamorphosis
entries: You can cast the {@spell polimorfia veritable} spell (save DC 18) from the bident, but you must cast it on a creature to turn it into a kind of creature that has an innate swimming speed. Once used, this property of the bident can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Destroying the Bident
entries: To destroy the bident, it must be heated by the breath of an {@creature drac vermell ancià} and then, while still hot, immersed in the Tartyx River.

item.name: Demon Armor
entries: Mentre vesteixis l'armadura, tens +1 a la CA, and you can understand and speak Abyssal. A més, the armor's clawed gauntlets turn atacs desarmats with your hands into armes màgiques that deal slashing damage, with a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls and a damage die of {@dice 1d8}.

entries.name: Maledicció
entries: Once you don this cursed armor, you can't doff it unless you are targeted by the {@spell anul·lar maledicció} spell or similar magic. While wearing the armor, you have disadvantage on attack rolls against demons and on saving throws against their spells and special abilities.

item.name: Demonomicon of Iggwilv
entries: An expansive treatise documenting the Abyss's infinite layers and inhabitants, the Demonomicon of Iggwilv is the most thorough and blasphemous tome of demonology in the multiverse. The tome recounts both the oldest and most current profanities of the Abyss and demons. Demons have attempted to censor the text, and while sections have been ripped from the book's spine, the general chapters remain, ever revealing demonic secrets. And the book holds more than blasphemies. Caged behind lines of script roils a secret piece of the Abyss itself, which keeps the book up-to-date, no matter how many pages are removed, and it longs to be more than mere reference material.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The artifact has the follow random properties, which you can determine by rolling on the tables in the "Artifacts" section of the {@book Guia del Mestre de Masmorres|DMG}:

items: 2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} properties
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental} property
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Detrimental Properties|dmg|major detrimental} property

entries.name: Conjurs
entries: The book té 8 càrregues. recupera {@dice 1d8} càrregues gastades cada dia a trenc d'alba. While holding it, pots, com a acció, cast {@spell Riure Horrible de la Tasha} from it or to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells (save DC 20) from it: {@spell cercle màgic} (1 charge), {@spell gerra màgica} (3 charges), {@spell planar ally} (3 charges), {@spell vincle planar} (2 charges), {@spell saltar de pla} (to layers of the Abyss only; 3 charges), {@spell convocar infernal|TCE} (3 charges).

entries.name: Abyssal Reference
entries: You can reference the {@i Demonomicon} whenever you make an Intel·ligència check to discern information about demons or una tirada de Saviesa ({@skill Supervivència}) related to the Abyss. When you do so, you can add double el teu bonus de competència to the check.

entries.name: Fiendish Scourging
entries: Your magic causes pain to diastres. While carrying the book, when you make a damage roll for a spell you cast against a fiend, you use the maximum possible result instead of rolling.

entries.name: Ensnarement
entries: While carrying the book, whenever you cast the {@spell cercle màgic} spell naming only diastres, or the {@spell vincle planar} spell targeting a fiend, the spell is cast at 9th level, regardless of what level spell slot you used, if any. Additionally, the diastre has disadvantage on its saving throw against the spell.

entries.name: Containment
entries: The first 10 pages of the {@i Demonomicon} are blank. As an action while holding the book, you can target a diastre that you can see that is trapped within a {@spell cercle màgic}. The diastre must succeed on a DC 20 Carisma saving throw with disadvantage or become trapped within one of the {@i Demonomicon's} empty blank pages, which fills with writing detailing the trapped creature's widely known name and depravities. Once used, this action no es pot tornar a utilitzar fins el proper trenc d'alba.

When you finish a long rest, if you and the {@i Demonomicon} are on the same plane of existence, the trapped creature of the highest challenge rating within the book can attempt to possess you. You ha de salvar per Carisma (CD 20). On a failure, you are possessed by the creature, which controls you like a puppet. The possessing creature can release you com a acció, appearing in the closest unoccupied space. Si supera, the diastre can't try to possess you again for 7 days.
When the tome is discovered, it has {@dice 1d4} diastres occupying its pages, typically an assortment of demons.

entries.name: Destroying the Demonomicon
entries: To destroy the book, six different demon lords must each tear out a sixth of the book's pages. If this occurs, the pages reappear passades 24 hores. Before all those hours pass, anyone who opens the book's remaining binding is transported to a nascent layer of the Abyss that lies hidden within the book. At the heart of this deadly, semi-sentient domain lies a long-lost artifact, {@i Fraz-Urb'luu's Staff}. If the staff is dragged from the pocket plane, the tome is reduced to a mundane and quite out-of-date copy of the {@i Tome of Zyx}, the work that served as the foundation for the {@i Demonomicon}. Once the staff emerges, the demon lord Fraz-Urb'luu instantly knows.

item.name: Devastation Orb of Air
entries: A devastation orb is an elemental bomb that can be created at the site of an elemental node by performing a ritual with an arma elemental. The type of orb created depends on the node used. For example, an air node creates a devastation orb of air. The ritual takes 1 hour to complete and requires 2,000 gp worth of special components, which are consumed.

A devastation orb measures 12 inches in diameter, weighs 10 pounds, and has a solid outer shell. The orb detonates {@dice 1d100} hours after its creation, releasing the elemental energy it contains. The orb gives no outward sign of how much time remains before it will detonate. Spells such as {@spell identificar} i {@spell endevinació} can be used to ascertain when the orb will explode. An orb has AC 10, 15 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Reducing it to 0 hit points causes it to explode instantly.

A special container can be crafted to contain a devastation orb and prevent it from detonating. The container must be inscribed with symbols of the orb's opposing element. For example, a case inscribed with earth symbols can be used to contain a devastation orb of air and keep it from detonating. While in the container, the orb thrums. If it is removed from the container after the time when it was supposed to detonate, it explodes {@dice 1d6} rounds later, unless it is returned to the container.
Regardless of the type of orb, its effect is contained within a sphere with a 1 mile radius. The orb is the sphere's point of origin. The orb is destroyed after one use.

entries.name: Air Orb
entries: When this orb detonates, it creates a powerful windstorm that dura 1 hora. Whenever a creature ends its turn exposed to the wind, la criatura ha de salvar per Constitució (CD 18). Si falla, rep {@dice 1d4} de dany contundent, as the wind and debris batter it. The wind is strong enough to uproot weak trees and destroy light structures after at least 10 minutes of exposure. Otherwise, the rules for {@hazard strong wind} apply, as detailed in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

item.name: Devastation Orb of Earth
entries: A devastation orb is an elemental bomb that can be created at the site of an elemental node by performing a ritual with an arma elemental. The type of orb created depends on the node used. For example, an air node creates a {@item devastation orb of air|PotA}. The ritual takes 1 hour to complete and requires 2,000 gp worth of special components, which are consumed.

A devastation orb measures 12 inches in diameter, weighs 10 pounds, and has a solid outer shell. The orb detonates {@dice 1d100} hours after its creation, releasing the elemental energy it contains. The orb gives no outward sign of how much time remains before it will detonate. Spells such as {@spell identificar} i {@spell endevinació} can be used to ascertain when the orb will explode. An orb has AC 10, 15 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Reducing it to 0 hit points causes it to explode instantly.

A special container can be crafted to contain a devastation orb and prevent it from detonating. The container must be inscribed with symbols of the orb's opposing element. For example, a case inscribed with earth symbols can be used to contain a {@item devastation orb of air|PotA} and keep it from detonating. While in the container, the orb thrums. If it is removed from the container after the time when it was supposed to detonate, it explodes {@dice 1d6} rounds later, unless it is returned to the container.
Regardless of the type of orb, its effect is contained within a sphere with a 1 mile radius. The orb is the sphere's point of origin. The orb is destroyed after one use.

entries.name: Earth Orb
entries: When this orb detonates, it subjects the area to the effects of the {@spell terratrèmol} spell for 1 minute (spell save DC 18). For the purpose of the spell's effects, the spell is cast on the turn that the orb explodes.

item.name: Devastation Orb of Fire
entries: A devastation orb is an elemental bomb that can be created at the site of an elemental node by performing a ritual with an arma elemental. The type of orb created depends on the node used. For example, an air node creates a {@item devastation orb of air|PotA}. The ritual takes 1 hour to complete and requires 2,000 gp worth of special components, which are consumed.

A devastation orb measures 12 inches in diameter, weighs 10 pounds, and has a solid outer shell. The orb detonates {@dice 1d100} hours after its creation, releasing the elemental energy it contains. The orb gives no outward sign of how much time remains before it will detonate. Spells such as {@spell identificar} i {@spell endevinació} can be used to ascertain when the orb will explode. An orb has AC 10, 15 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Reducing it to 0 hit points causes it to explode instantly.

A special container can be crafted to contain a devastation orb and prevent it from detonating. The container must be inscribed with symbols of the orb's opposing element. For example, a case inscribed with earth symbols can be used to contain a {@item devastation orb of air|PotA} and keep it from detonating. While in the container, the orb thrums. If it is removed from the container after the time when it was supposed to detonate, it explodes {@dice 1d6} rounds later, unless it is returned to the container.
Regardless of the type of orb, its effect is contained within a sphere with a 1 mile radius. The orb is the sphere's point of origin. The orb is destroyed after one use.

entries.name: Fire Orb
entries: When this orb detonates, it creates a dry heat wave that dura 24 hores. Within the area of effect, the rules for {@hazard extreme heat} apply, as detailed in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide. At the end of each hour, there is a ten percent chance that the heat wave starts a wildfire in a random location within the area of effect. The wildfire covers a 10-foot-square area initially but expands to fill another 10-foot square each round until the fire is extinguished or burns itself out. A creature that comes within 10 feet of a wildfire per primer cop en un torn o hi començi el torn takes {@dice 3d6} de dany de foc.

item.name: Devastation Orb of Water
entries: A devastation orb is an elemental bomb that can be created at the site of an elemental node by performing a ritual with an arma elemental. The type of orb created depends on the node used. For example, an air node creates a {@item devastation orb of air|PotA}. The ritual takes 1 hour to complete and requires 2,000 gp worth of special components, which are consumed.

A devastation orb measures 12 inches in diameter, weighs 10 pounds, and has a solid outer shell. The orb detonates {@dice 1d100} hours after its creation, releasing the elemental energy it contains. The orb gives no outward sign of how much time remains before it will detonate. Spells such as {@spell identificar} i {@spell endevinació} can be used to ascertain when the orb will explode. An orb has AC 10, 15 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Reducing it to 0 hit points causes it to explode instantly.

A special container can be crafted to contain a devastation orb and prevent it from detonating. The container must be inscribed with symbols of the orb's opposing element. For example, a case inscribed with earth symbols can be used to contain a {@item devastation orb of air|PotA} and keep it from detonating. While in the container, the orb thrums. If it is removed from the container after the time when it was supposed to detonate, it explodes {@dice 1d6} rounds later, unless it is returned to the container.
Regardless of the type of orb, its effect is contained within a sphere with a 1 mile radius. The orb is the sphere's point of origin. The orb is destroyed after one use.

entries.name: Water Orb
entries: When this orb detonates, it creates a torrential rainstorm that dura 24 hores. Within the area of effect, the rules for {@hazard heavy precipitation} apply, as detailed in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide. If there is a substantial body of water in the area, it floods after {@dice 2d10} hours of heavy rain, rising 10 feet above its banks and inundating the surrounding area. The flood advances at a rate of 100 feet per round, moving away from the body of water where it began until it reaches the edge of the area of effect: at that point, the water flows downhill (and possibly recedes back to its origin). Light structures collapse and wash away. Any Large or smaller creature caught in the flood's path is swept away. The flooding destroys crops and might trigger mudslides, depending on the terrain.

entries.items: If you attune to this staff, you transform into a goat-humanoid hybrid over the course of 3 days. Tíflins are immune to this curse. Throughout the first day, shaggy fur begins to grow all over your body. Passades 24 hores, your eyes become goat-like, and stumpy horns sprout from your brow. On the last day, your fingers and toes meld into double digits, and the horns grow to full length. This transformation doesn't prevent you from wielding weapons or casting spells. {@spell Anul·lar Maledicció}, {@spell restabliment superior}, or any other effect that ends a curse restores your original appearance, but only a {@spell desig} spell can rid the staff of its power to transform those who attune to it.

item.name: Devotee's Censer
entries: The rounded head of this flail is perforated with tiny holes, arranged in symbols and patterns. The flail counts as a holy symbol for you. When you hit with an attack using this magic flail, the target rep {@damage 1d8} de dany radiant extra.

Com a acció bonus, you can speak the paraula màgica to cause the flail to emanate a thin cloud of incense out to 10 feet durant 1 minut. A l'inici de cada torn teu, you and any other creatures in the incense each regain {@dice 1d4} hit points. This property no es pot tornar a utilitzar fins el proper trenc d'alba.

item.name: Diamond
entries: A transparent blue-white, canary, pink, brown, or blue gemstone.

item.name: Dimensional Loop
entries: While attuned to this device, you have a +1 bonus to Força saving throws, and tens {@sense visió de foscor} a 60 peus d'abast. If you already have {@sense visió de foscor}, its range increases by 30 feet.

entries.name: Dimensional Cloak
entries: Com a acció bonus, you send your body out of phase with the material world for 1 minute, granting you advantage on Destresa ({@skill Sigil}) checks made to hide, and imposing disadvantage on attack rolls against you. Once you use this feature of the dimensional loop, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Fold Space
entries: Choose a space que puguis veure a 60 peus d'abast (no requereix acció). You treat that space as if it were within 5 feet of you fins el final del teu torn. This allows you to move immediately to that space sense provocar atacs d'oportunitat, or to interact with objects or creatures in that space as though they were next to you (including allowing you to make melee attacks into that space). Once you use this feature of the dimensional loop, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Part of a Whole
entries: While this component is not installed in the {@item Orrery of the Wanderer|AI}, its magic might function sporadically or with unpredictable side effects, as determined by el/la/li MM.

item.name: Grillets Dimensionals
entries: Pots, com a acció, place these shackles on an {@condition incapacitat} creature. The shackles adjust to fit a creature of Small to Large size. In addition to serving as mundane esposes, the shackles prevent a creature bound by them from using any method of extradimensional movement, including teleportation or travel to a different plane of existence. They don't prevent the creature from passing-through an interdimensional portal.

You and any creature you designate when you use the shackles can use an action to remove them. Once every 30 days, the bound creature can make una tirada de Força ({@skill Atletisme}) amb CD 30. On a success, the creature breaks free and destroys the shackles.

item.name: Dimir Guild Signet
entries: This ring, adorned with the symbol of Dimir, allows you to cast {@spell ego camuflatge}. A guild signet is sometimes awarded to a guild member whose renown score in that guild is 5 or higher, as a reward for performing special services for the guild. Aside from its magical properties, the ring is also an indicator of Dimir's recognition and favor.
A signet has 3 charges, and recupera {@dice 1d3} càrregues gastades cada dia a trenc d'alba. While wearing it, you can expend 1 charge to cast the associated spell (save DC 13).

item.name: Dimir Keyrune
item.reqAttune: by a member of the Dimir guild
entries: This keyrune, carved from black stone accented with steel, resembles a stylized horror. On command, it transforms into an {@creature intellect devourer} that resembles the Dimir guild symbol, with six bladelike legs. The creature exists for up to 24 hours. During that time, it pursues only a single mission you give it—usually an assignment to take over someone's body, either to impersonate that person for a brief time or to extract secrets from their mind. When the mission is complete, the creature returns to you, reports its success, and reverts to its keyrune form.

When you use an action to speak the item's paraula màgica and place the keyrune on the ground en un espai desocupat within 5 feet of you, the keyrune transforms into a {@creature intellect devourer}. If there isn't enough space for the creature, the keyrune doesn't transform.

The creature is friendly to you, your companions, and other members of your guild (unless those guild members are hostile to you). It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature takes the {@action Esquivar} action and moves to avoid danger.

At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its keyrune form. It reverts early if it es queda a 0 punts de vida or if you use an action to speak the paraula màgica again while touching it. When the creature reverts to its keyrune form, it can't transform again until 36 hours have passed.

item.name: Pack de Diplomàcia
entries: Includes:

items: a {@item cofre|phb}
2 {@item caixa de mapes o pergamins|phb|cases for maps and scrolls}
a set of {@item roba bona|phb}
a {@item Ink (1-ounce bottle)|phb|bottle of ink}
an {@item ink pen|phb}
a {@item lamp|phb}
2 {@item Oli (matràs)|phb|flasks of oil}
5 {@item Paper (una fulla)|phb|fulles de paper}
a {@item Perfum (vial)|phb|vial of perfume}
{@item lacre|phb}
{@item soap|phb}

item.name: Kit de disfressa
entries: This pouch of cosmetics, hair dye, and small props lets you create disguises that change your physical appearance. Tenir competència amb aquest kit et permet sumar el teu bonus de competència a tota tirada d'habilitat per a create a visual disguise.
additionalEntries: The perfect tool for anyone who wants to engage in trickery, a kit de disfressa enables its owner to adopt a false identity.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: A kit de disfressa includes cosmetics, hair dye, small props, and a few pieces of clothing.

additionalEntries.name: Deception
entries: In certain cases, a disguise can improve your ability to weave convincing lies.

additionalEntries.name: Intimidation
entries: The right disguise can make you look more fearsome, whether you want to scare someone away by posing as a plague victim or intimidate a gang of thugs by taking the appearance of a bully.

additionalEntries.name: Performance
entries: A cunning disguise can enhance an audience's enjoyment of a performance, provided the disguise is properly designed to evoke the desired reaction.

additionalEntries.name: Persuasió
entries: Folk tend to trust a person in uniform. If you disguise yourself as an authority figure, your efforts to persuade others are often more effective.

additionalEntries.name: Create Disguise
entries: Com a part d'un Descans Llarg, you can create a disguise. It takes you 1 minute to don such a disguise once you have created it. You can carry only one such disguise on you at a time without drawing undue attention, unless you have a bossa de contenció or a similar method to keep them hidden. Each disguise weighs 1 pound.
At other times, it takes 10 minutes to craft a disguise that involves moderate changes to your appearance, and 30 minutes for one that requires more extensive changes.

additionalEntries.caption: Kit de disfressa
rows: Cover injuries or distinguishing marks
Spot a disguise being used by someone else
Copy a humanoid's appearance

item.name: Dispelling Stone
entries: This smooth, rainbow-colored, egg-shaped stone can be thrown fins a 30 peus and explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere of magical energy on impact, destroying the stone. Any active spell of 5th level or lower in the sphere ends.

item.name: Docent
entries: A docent is a small metal sphere, about 2 inches across, studded with dragonshards. To attune to a docent, you must embed the item somewhere on your body, such as your chest or your eye socket.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: A docent is a sentient item of any alignment with an Intel·ligència of 16, a Saviesa of 14, and a Carisma of 14. It perceives the world through your senses. It communicates telepathically with you and can speak, read, and understand any language it knows (see "Random Properties" below).

entries.name: Life Support
entries: Whenever you end your turn with 0 hit points, the docent can make una tirada de Saviesa ({@skill Medicina}) with a +6 bonus. If this check succeeds, the docent stabilizes you.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: A docent has the following properties:

{@b Languages}. The docent knows Common, Giant, and {@dice 1d4} additional languages chosen by el/la/li MM. If a docent knows fewer than six languages, it can learn a new language after it hears or reads the language through your senses.
{@b Skills}. The docent has a +7 bonus to one of the following skills (roll a {@dice d4}): (1) {@skill Arcana}, (2) {@skill History}, (3) {@skill Investigation}, or (4) {@skill Nature}.

{@b Spells}. The docent knows one of the following spells and can cast it at will, sense requerir components (roll a {@dice d6}): (1–2) {@spell detectar el bé i el mal} or (3–6) {@spell detectar màgia}. The docent decides when to cast the spell.

entries.name: Personality
entries: A docent is designed to advise and assist the guerraforjat it's attached to. One of the simple functions of a docent is to serve as a translator. The docent's properties are under its control, and if you have a bad relationship with your docent, it might refuse to assist you.

attachedSpells: detectar el bé i el mal

item.name: Documancy Satchel
entries: At rank 2, your documancy satchel becomes a common magic item, allowing you to magically send and receive documents to and from Head Office through a special pouch. Your documancy satchel magically produces prewritten and signature-ready contracts at your request, covering most common contractual needs. It also occasionally produces sticky notes printed with useful information and inspirational quotes from Head Office.

entries.name: Satchel of Holding
entries: At rank 3, your documancy satchel gains additional features and becomes an uncommon magic item. One of the satchel's pouches now functions as a {@item bossa de contenció}.

Additionally, pots, com a acció, draw forth from the documancy satchel a {@item spell pergamí} of {@spell comprendre idiomes}. The scroll vanishes when used, or ten minutes after it appears. This property of the bag no es pot tornar a utilitzar fins el proper trenc d'alba.

entries.name: Scroll Humidor
entries: At rank 4, your documancy satchel gains additional power and becomes a rare magic item. Within the satchel, a dedicated extradimensional space can hold up to thirty documents or {@item spell pergamí||spell scrolls}. Placing a single document into the scroll humidor is an action. Drawing forth a desired scroll is a bonus action.

item.name: Dodecahedron of Doom
entries: This twelve-sided metal die is 12 inches across and bears the numbers 1 through 12 engraved on its pentagonal sides. The dodecahedron contains arcane clockwork mechanisms that whir and click whenever the die is cast.

The dodecahedron can be hurled fins a 60 peus as an action. A random magical effect occurs when the die comes to rest after rolling across the ground for at least 10 feet. If an effect requires a target and no eligible target is within range, nothing happens. Spells cast by the dodecahedron require no components. Roll a {@dice d12} and consult the following table to determine the effect:

rows: The dodecahedron explodes and is destroyed. Each creature within 20 feet of the exploding die ha de salvar per Destresa (CD 13), taking 40 ({@dice 9d8}) de dany de força; si supera, en rep la meitat.
The dodecahedron casts {@spell llum} on itself. The effect lasts until a creature touches the die.
The dodecahedron casts {@spell raig gebre} (+5 a impactar), targeting a random creature within 60 feet of it that doesn't have total cover against the attack.
The dodecahedron casts {@spell braó electritzant} (+5 a impactar) on the next creature that touches it.
The dodecahedron casts {@spell foscor} on itself. The effect has a duration of 10 minutes.
The next creature to touch the dodecahedron gains {@dice 1d10} punts de vida temporals that last durant 1 hora.

item.name: Dogsled
entries: An empty sled costs 20 gp, weighs 300 pounds, and has room at the back for one driver.

item.name: Draakhorn
entries: The Draakhorn was a gift from {@creature Tiamat|RoT} in the war between dragons and giants. It was once the horn of her {@creature drac vermell ancià} consort, Ephelomon, that she gave to dragonkind to help them in their war against the giants. The Draakhorn is a signaling device, and it is so large that it requires two Medium creatures (or one Large or larger) to hold it while a third creature sounds it, making the earth resonate to its call. The horn has been blasted with fire into a dark ebony hue and is wrapped in bands of bronze with dracònic runes that glow with purple eldritch fire.

The low, moaning drone of the Draakhorn discomfits normal animals within a few miles, and it alerts all dragons within two thousand miles to rise and be wary, for great danger is at hand. Coded blasts were once used to signal specific messages. Knowledge of those codes has been lost to the ages.

Those with knowledge of the Draakhorn's history know that it was first built to signal danger to chromatic dragons—a purpose the Cult of the Dragon has corrupted to call chromatic dragons to the Well of Dragons from across the North.

Within 50 feet of any enclosed space where the horn is blown, the air begins to shimmer from the sound. Any character within 20 feet of the entry to the enclosed space must succeed on a DC 12 Força check to continue pushing against the pressure of the sound. A failure indicates the character can advance no farther toward the entry.

For any character entering the enclosed space, the sound fades to silence—because any creature that enters the enclosed space is temporarily {@condition eixordat} and ha de salvar per Constitució (CD 12). Success indicates the deafness ends 2 minutes after the Draakhorn ceases to sound. Failure indicates the character remains {@condition eixordat} durant 1 hora after the Draakhorn ceases to sound.

While the horn is sounding, a creature ha de salvar per Constitució (CD 15) the first time on a turn the creature enters a 150-foot cone in front of the horn or starts its turn there. Si falla, rep 27 ({@dice 6d8}) de dany de tro i està {@condition enderrocat}. Si supera, la criatura rep la meitat del dany i no està {@condition enderrocat}.

item.name: Dracònic Longsword
entries: This longsword has a dragon-shaped hilt. While you carry it, you gain the ability to speak and understand the Dracònic language.

item.name: Drac
entries: Gold coin, half again as large as a {@item nib|wdh} (1 dragon = 100 {@item nib|wdh|nibs})

item.name: Dragon Sensing Longsword
entries: This +1 longsword is made of dragon bone and with a dragon-leather grip. It has rubies in its pommel and hilt. The sword grows warm and the rubies glow slightly when the sword is within 120 feet of a dragon.

item.name: Dragon Thighbone Club
entries: This red dragon's thighbone is 14 feet long, 250 lbs, and is wrapped in old leather, suggesting that it was once used as a giant's greatclub.
Quan impactes a una criatura of the dragon type with this weapon, it deals an extra {@dice 2d8} de dany contundent.
If you attune to the greatclub, it magically shrinks to a size that you can wield effectively.

item.name: Dragon's Blood
entries: Introduced into Sharn by Daask, dragon's blood is a potent and highly addictive stimulant. In addition to inducing euphoria, it can enhance habilitat de llançament de conjurs or even temporarily imbue a user with the ability to cast conjurs de sortiller. The drug's effects are potentially dangerous and always unpredictable. This isn't something a player character should want to use; adventurers are more likely to interfere with Daask smugglers or deal with an addict who accidentally casts a {@spell bola de foc} in a crowded street. The specific effects of dragon's blood are up to you, but you can take inspiration from the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table in the {@book Manual del Jugador|PHB}.

item.name: Dragongleam
